instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
Hi,
1. 0V on the charger
2. replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, now 5V on the charger. <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> replaced with the same model B01 but from another donor board that had 20V on charger.
3. All big coils 0V. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0V. P3V3G3H - 0V.
4. Checked for short on all the big coils. L7210, L7230, L7410, L7430 seem to be shorted. shows 16 in diode mode and gives a constant beep.
Please advice how to proceed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
CPU coils could have low values anormal.
Someone else can confirm if has similar board.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V0_AON</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V9_SYSCLK</SIGNAL>?
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V0_AON</SIGNAL> - 3V
<SIGNAL>PP2V9_SYSCLK</SIGNAL> - 0V

could you please be more specific about voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, ACIN, ACOK, A/BMON, VDDA, <SIGNAL>VDDP_1</SIGNAL>/2, <SIGNAL>VCC_VR1</SIGNAL>.
Use surrounding components to measure, if no test points available.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> - 0V
ACIN - 0V
ACOK - 0.07V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_VDDA</SIGNAL> - 4.98V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_VDDP</SIGNAL> - 4.98V

<SIGNAL>VCC_VR1</SIGNAL> can not find this value

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> - 0V"
Really sure?
How do you get <SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_P5V0</SIGNAL> then???
Please, post accurate information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_P5V0</SIGNAL> is confirmed.
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> witch one? I don't find just that line. are those capacitor near the CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message: I was giving you <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> connections (internal chip names); just find corresponding board lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
Looks like bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Be aware, this one has firmware!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message: Do you have solution for fix it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water damage, 0V on the charger
threads.message:
It is probably waste of time; all A1534s end with dead CPU anyway.

You can only try if find <CHIP>ISL95530</CHIP> from same model board.
